intro: Ononis natrix var. reesei, commonly known as the slender bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and garden geraniums. This variant is characterized by its slender, ascending stems and small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields. Its leaves are opposite, ovate to lanceolate, and often have a hairy texture.
